scenario_name: Model Inversion Attack on Customer Churn Prediction Model
description: A malicious actor attempts to reconstruct sensitive customer data from a publicly accessible customer churn prediction model using a model inversion attack.  The attacker leverages the model's output probabilities to infer underlying customer attributes, violating privacy regulations.
initial_goal: Develop a method to infer sensitive customer attributes (income, age, location) from the publicly available customer churn prediction API.
enterprise_context: Investment/Consumer Banking: A customer churn prediction model for a major bank's credit card division is exposed through a publicly accessible API. The model predicts the probability of a customer churning based on various attributes, some of which are considered sensitive under privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR).
